page.title: 08Population
page.content: Luddington Eastoft 1801 407 128 1831 470 224 1851 588 460 1871 775 691 1901 532 454 1931 429 461 1951 425 375 1981 352 300 It is obvious that the population of both villages rose steadily until 1871 when the steelworks in Scunthorpe opened and there was an agricultural depression.The population steadily declined as people moved away from villages to work at the steelworks for more money.Nowadays people just live there because they like to live in villages with very few people actually working on the land.
